document.docTitle: Ceraeochrysa torresi Sosa & Freitas 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New Neotropical species of Ceraeochrysa Adams (Neuroptera: Chrysopidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Neotropical species of Ceraeochrysa Adams (Neuroptera: Chrysopidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Museo Entomológico " Dr. José Manuel Osorio " (UCOB), Universidad Centroccidental " Lisandro Alvarado ", Venezuela. PhD student at the Universidade Estadual Paulista, Jaboticabal, São Paulo, Brazil. E-mail: fransodu 73 @ hotmail. com
Universidade Estadual Paulista, Jaboticabal, São Paulo, Brazil. E-mail: serfre @ fcav. unesp. br

heading.emphasis:
Ceraeochrysa torresi Sosa & Freitas
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Holotype . Male.
Measurements. Head: width 1.6 mm . Pronotum: length 0.8 mm , width 1.1 mm . Forewing: length 13.5 mm , width 4.4 mm , length/width ratio = 3.1. Hindwing: length 11.8 mm , width 3.6 mm , length/width ratio = 3.3. Forewing with 2 inner and 5 outer gradates, hindwing with 1 inner and 6 outer gradates.
Head: Front, gena, clypeus, maxillary and labial palpi pale; vertex pale green; scape and flagellum with a diffuse dorsolateral patch and flagellum with pale amber coloration (Fig. 7).

Thorax: Pronotum green with a lateral red stripe on each side (Fig. 7); Meso- and metanota pale green or greenish yellow; pleura pale green; legs pale with yellow tarsi. Forewing: Longitudinal veins: green; Crossveins: costal crossveins 3–11, Rs + Ma, radial crossveins 1–8, and series of gradates black. Hindwing: longitudinal veins and crossveins green (Fig. 8).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 27–35. Male and female genitalia of
Ceraeochrysa torresi
sp. nov .
27–33, male genitalia. 27, 28—Sternite 9 + ectoproct. 29, 30—Gonarcus in dorsal view. 31, 32—Gonarcus in lateral view. 33—Gonapsis in dorsal and lateral view. 34–35, female genitalia. 34—Sub-genitalia in frontal view. 35—Spermatheca in lateral view. ar = arcessus; dh = dorsal hood; dl = dorsal lobe; go = gonarcus; gco = gonocornua; la = lateral arm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen: Green, some specimens with rounded red marks on the first five tergites. Apodeme of tergite 9 + ectoproct sclerotized and with ventral digitiform projection below the callus cerci ; lateral to the genital atria a field of tiny scales arranged in several lines ( Figs. 27–28 ). Male genitalia: Gonarcus markedly curved, with an oval dorsal hood; lateral arms wide, rounded at base and narrow at apex; two inflated dorsolateral gonocornua with irregular margin projected posteriorly from gonarcus; arcessus membranous basally with two dorsal inflated, horn-shaped lobes or processes; apex ventrally directed and laterally lobulated; gonococcus with long gonosetae; gonocristae present ( Figs. 29–32 ). Gonapsis long and flattened, apex with short lateral projections and rounded point of laminar-shape ( Fig. 33 ).

Allotype .
Similar to holotype . Measurements. Head: width 1.6 mm . Pronotum: length 0.8 mm , width 1.1 mm . Forewing: length 11.4 mm , width 3.8 mm , length/width ratio = 3.0. Hindwing: length 10.0 mm, width 3.1 mm , length/width ratio = 3.2. Forewing with 1 inner and 5 outer gradates, hindwing with 1 inner and 5 outer gradates.

Male mean measurements. Head: width 1.5 mm (range 1.4–1.6 mm ). Pronotum: length 0.8 mm (range 0.7–0.8 mm ), width 1.1 mm (range 1.0– 1.2 mm ). Forewing: length 13.4 mm (range 12.1–15.9 mm ), width 4.3 mm (range 4.0–5.0 mm), length/width ratio = 3.1 (range 3.0–3.2); 1–2 inner and 5–6 outer gradates. Hindwing: length 11.8 mm (range 10.8–14.1 mm ), width 3.4 mm (range 3.3–3.6 mm ), length/width ratio = 3.3 (range 3.2–3.4); 1–2 inner and 5–6 outer gradates.
Etymology. The name pays homage to the student José Pastor Torres García for his great dedication and collaboration in carrying out this work.

Discussion.
Ceraeochrysa torresi
sp. nov.
, is related to the “
everes
” group of species.
Ceraeochrysa torresi
sp. nov.
, may be distinguished from other species in the group for being the only one with a paleamber flagellum. Most of the specimens studied were collected in
Citrus spp.
,
Annona muricata
L orchards, and with white light traps.
